description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about:
This section asks for information about:
This section asks for information about your business's use of UK Freeports.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
the main concern to your business

contents.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:
This section asks for information about how your business has been affected by recent industrial action.
This section asks for information about your business's use of artificial intelligence.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

summary.page_title: Trading status of your business section

contents.description: This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s trading status?

description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

in: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

question.title: How did your business's exporting in August 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
Did your business experience an increase in any of the following exporting challenges in August 2023, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced an increase in additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules of origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges
options.value: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges

question.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s importing status?

question.title: How did your business's importing in August 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced an increase in additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules of origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs

options.label: Customs duties or levies

options.value: Finding information on how to import

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.value: Did not experience an increase in any importing challenges

options.label: End of the EU transition period

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business's use of UK Freeports.

title.text: Does {ru_name} plan to import or export goods to or from UK Freeports in the next 12 months?

contents.description: This refers to designated zones within England and Wales, and Green Freeports in Scotland, where eligible businesses can benefit from a package of measures that include tax reliefs, simplified customs trade and investment support.

question.title: Why is your business not planning to import or export goods from UK Freeports within the next 12 months?

options.label: Application is unlikely to be processed in time
options.value: Application is unlikely to be processed in time

options.label: Application was rejected by HM Revenue and Customs
options.value: Application was rejected by HM Revenue and Customs

options.label: Business does not import or export goods to or from the UK
options.value: Business does not import or export goods to or from the UK

options.label: Business is already utilising existing customs procedures
options.value: Business is already utilising existing customs procedures

options.label: Business is not located in a designated freeport area
options.value: Business is not located in a designated freeport area

in: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
options.value: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.value: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

options.label: Falling demand of goods and services
options.value: Falling demand of goods and services

summary.page_title: Sending goods to Northern Ireland section

contents.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.
Include goods sent to:
GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

title.text: Has {ru_name} sent goods from GB to Northern Ireland in the last 12 months?

contents.description: Include
Goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland to:
This refers to ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

blocks.page_title: Sending goods to Northern Ireland in the last year

question.title: In August 2023, how did the volume of goods your business sent from GB to Northern Ireland compare with the previous calendar month?

options.label: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland
options.value: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as:

title.text: Is {ru_name} using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

description: If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

question.title: Why is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

options.label: Reduced carbon emissions
options.description: For example, due to less travelling to and from the workplace

any-in: Ability to better match jobs to skills
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK

question.title: Why is your business not intending to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace
options.value: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace

options.label: Costs of employee equipment
options.description: For example, the technology and equipment required to enable homeworking such as laptops or desks

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff

question.title: On average, how many days a week do your business's employees currently work from home?
description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

options.label: One to two days a week
options.value: One to two days a week

options.label: Three to four days a week
options.value: Three to four days a week

options.label: Five or more days a week
options.value: Five or more days a week

options.label: Employees do not work from home
options.value: Employees do not work from home

question.title: What are your business's expectations for the number of days a week employees will work from home in the next 12 months?
description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

options.label: Number of days will likely increase
options.value: Number of days will likely increase

options.label: Number of days will likely stay the same
options.value: Number of days will likely stay the same

options.label: Number of days will likely decrease
options.value: Number of days will likely decrease

blocks.page_title: Business expectations for working from home

question.title: On average, how did employees’ hourly wages in August 2023 compare with employees’ hourly wages in the previous calendar month?
description: If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

question.title: Is your business currently experiencing a shortage of workers?
How has the shortage of workers affected your business?

options.label: Business had to pause trading entirely
options.value: Business had to pause trading entirely

options.label: Had to pause trading of some of the business
options.value: Had to pause trading of some of the business

options.label: Business had to recruit temporary workers
options.value: Business had to recruit temporary workers

contents.description: This section asks for information about how your business has been affected by recent industrial action.

title.text: Was {ru_name} affected by industrial action in August 2023?

contents.description: Include direct or indirect impact of industrial action to your business
This refers to when workers go on strike or take other action, such as refusing to do overtime.

options.label: No, the business was not affected
options.value: No, the business was not affected

question.title: How was your business affected by industrial action in August 2023?

contents.description: Include direct or indirect impact of industrial action to your business

options.label: Business was unable to obtain necessary goods
options.value: Business was unable to obtain necessary goods

options.label: Business was unable to obtain necessary services
options.value: Business was unable to obtain necessary services

options.label: Business was unable to operate fully
options.value: Business was unable to operate fully

options.label: Part or all of the workforce were directly involved in industrial action
options.value: Part or all of the workforce were directly involved in industrial action

options.label: Workforce had to change their working location
options.value: Workforce had to change their working location

options.label: Workforce were unable to perform their roles
options.value: Workforce were unable to perform their roles

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business's use of artificial intelligence.

title.text: Which, if any, of the following artificial intelligence technologies does {ru_name} currently use?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'artificial intelligence technologies'

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Data processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, personalisation of shopping or product recommendations, fraud prevention or cybersecurity

options.label: Image processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, for facial recognition, quality control or object detection

options.label: Robotics
options.description: For example, for carrying goods in hospitals or warehouses

options.label: Text generation using Large Language Models
options.value: Text generation using Large Language Models
options.description: For example, chatbots that interact in a conversational way and can answer complex questions, computer coding assistance, creating first drafts of papers or topic research or social media posts and public communications

options.label: Visual content creation
options.description: For example, for use in graphic design or videos

options.label: Business is not currently using artificial intelligence technologies
options.value: Business is not currently using artificial intelligence technologies

blocks.page_title: Current use of artificial intelligence technologies

question.title: What does your business currently use artificial intelligence technologies for?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'artificial intelligence technologies'

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Develop a new product or service, or explore a new market
options.value: Develop a new product or service, or explore a new market
options.description: Including forecasting and user testing

options.label: Image processing using machine learning
options.description: For example, for facial recognition, quality control, or object detection

options.label: Improve business operations
options.description: For example, to increase productivity, create efficiencies or to reduce costs

options.label: Provide, or personalise, products or services to customers
options.value: Provide, or personalise, products or services to customers

blocks.page_title: How artificial intelligence technologies are used

options.description: Fully, or by adapting existing software

options.label: Outsourced to external providers or third parties
options.value: Outsourced to external providers or third parties

options.value: Through purchase of external software or ready-to-use

question.title: In the last 3 months, which, if any, of the following factors have prevented or delayed your business in the adoption of artificial intelligence technologies?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'artificial intelligence technologies'

contents.description: This refers to computer programs or machines that can learn from data and perform tasks usually done by humans.

options.label: Employee concern about any potential impact of using artificial intelligence technologies
options.value: Employee concern about any potential impact of using artificial intelligence technologies
options.description: For example, concern about job security, safety of implementation and usage, efficiency, impacts on workload, privacy or other moral concerns

options.label: Level of expertise in artificial intelligence
options.value: Level of expertise in artificial intelligence

options.label: Uncertainty about government regulations or industry standards
options.value: Uncertainty about government regulations or industry standards

options.label: Business has not been prevented or experienced delays in the adoption of artificial intelligence technologies
